column1: Index,Reviews
Especially with an item that is counterfeited as often as Egyptian Cotton sheets
column2: you can't just depend on the product description you must also consider who is selling the product.  Lowest price is not always the most important factor.  Someone can list a product labeled "Egyptian Quality" but that is really just synthetic material
column3: under the same label as the genuine product.  I suspect that many of the poorer ratings here came from that situation.  Look for sellers who have a good rating for many sales
column4: not just a small number.I can only rate the product received based on the particular seller I bought from
column5: "Egyptian Cotton Factory Outlet Store".  I chose this seller because of their high ratings
column6: and because I assumed that their shipping from inside the US would have faster delivery than other sellers who imported.  I am sure that many of the other sellers also have a good product
column7: but I did not purchase from them.  The product that I received from the seller that I chose was outstanding.The product was clearly labeled "100% Egyptian Cotton" and also had the "Seal of the Egyptian Government".  I have found good Egyptian Cotton sheets in the past
column8: but these were the best I have seen.  The sheets are lighter weight than prior purchases which gives them a much softer feel.  The pillow cases are a little smaller (tighter) than prior purchases
column9: but they still fit the pillows and actually seem to provide a more snug fit where you don't have to fold excess material under.  I have nothing negative to say about this order.  Definitely 5 stars.

column1: I bought these 8 months ago when I was having trouble finding queen sheets with deep enough pockets here locally. I also don't have days to just drag myself from place to place looking for sheets. With a great price of a hundred bucks
column2: I figured I should give these a try.Just for the record
column3: I can be pretty picky with sheets. I also sleep with a duvet rather than a top sheet and use the top sheet on TOP of the duvet to keep the doggie hair away so how it washes becomes critically important. I also only use white sheets and covers
column4: again meaning that how it washes is crucial.After getting the package (well packaged and quick) I washed the sheets per directions and they fluffed up very nicely with that new sheet look. Egyptian cotton...long staple...has a unique look and feel to it and these definitely had that. The pockets were
column6: deep enough for my bed and it fit just right.Several washes later the softness really increased and they reached perfect comfort level.Now
column7: after 8 months of being switched out to be used every third week on the bed (3 sets changed each week) they are still in perfect condition. The occasionally dirty dog leaves his share of dinginess on the top sheet
column8: but so far none of it has stayed after washing and they look pretty much brand new.I will say they did shrink a little
column10: as they did get tighter around the pocket. I'm assuming my dryer went a little higher in temp or time at some point.Based on the other reviews
column11: I think there may be a consistency problem. The descriptions of the sheets vary quite a bit so anyone considering these should keep that in mind. Great buy for me at a great price.

column1: We bought a wonderful mattress a few years ago. The only problem is that none of the 18 inch sheets sold in the stores and on line fit properly. Consequently
column2: the sheets would bunch up under neath us as we rolled around in our sleep. It wasn't until I stumbled upon a 21 inch set of sheets in HomeGoods. However
column3: it was a fluke finding that size sheets. After searching every store in town we finally found these on line. They aren't cheap and they weren't delivered in 2 days; more like three weeks. But now we have a second set of fitted sheets that give us comfort for a good nights sleep.

column1: I was very disappointed with the quality of these sheets.  Says 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton.  Very thin and after two washings
column2: the fitted sheet is balling up and makes sleeping very uncomfortable.  For this reason I would not buy again although they did fit my deep pocketed mattress.

column1: The ONLY good thing about these sheets is how deep the pockets are. Other than that
column2: they are the worst sheets I have EVER owned. The crisp high thread county quality I was hoping for washed out in the first wash and dry. My lint trap was full after the first dryer cycle. DO NOT BUY!!

column1: The product is not as described.  The only good thing I can say is the vendor promptly refunded my purchase price.
Answer to our prayers. Stays on and tucked. I accidentally ordered a Queen size
column2: they exchanged it quickly with no problems.

column1: I highly recommend these sheets.  After a year of trying different brands
column2: I finally found one with deep enough pockets!  Material is super soft and does not shrink.  I will buy more of these in the future.  Worth every penny.

column1: I have purchased high thread count sheets
column2: numerous times.  I cannot imagine how these are categorized with them.  They are paper thin and look like they will fall apart in one or two washings.  I don't know what else to say

column1: cheap

column1: We needed these for our deep mattress and I bought 2 sets. The first set became pulled even though I dried on low setting. so they remain in the closet...
Exactly as ordered - no surprises and delivered to my door.  For the price
column2: these are really nice sheets.  My wife and I love them.

column1: These sheets fit perfect with a little room to spare over a pillow top mattress with a Novaform® 3" Gel Memory Foam Mattress Topper from Costco. They  have kept their shape through several washes.  The only criticism I have for being Egyptian Cotton with a 1
column2: 000 thread count
column3: is they seem scratchy and not as soft as I expected for a high thread count.

column1: I ordered 1500 thread count hoping they were slightly thicker than my existing 1200 thread count sheets. This appears not to be the case. Otherwise

column1: Wonderful. Very soft and met my expectations.
These sheets fit perfectly. Its so nice to not have to pull the sheets back on every time I get out of bed. They are so soft right out of the package. I'm definitely getting another set!!
Grest quality
I bought these thinking I was getting 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton sheets.  I have bought several sets of Pioneer sheets from another seller and loved them. However
column2: these came in silky like satin. The lint was "awful." I had to vacuum out my dryer and floor
column4: wash the sheets twice and take them outside to shake the lint of. They were less expensive than the others I had ordered. I thought I was getting a better deal. However
column5: I would not have bought these sheets if I knew they were satin feel. I don't think they have cotton in them at all. I can't find a tag on them either. Wish I could return them. I'm showing photos of the lint. I'm also comparing the sheets with the satin texture with the other Egyptian cotton sheets that I bought. You can see the difference. If you like "satin feel sheets" these sheets are for you.

column1: Nicely soft but the mattress sheet rubber band is stretched out. Have to use clips to keep it in place.https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B01M1JUJ8H/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1506815077&sr=8-2-sponsπ=AC_SX236_SY340_QL65&keywords=mattress%2Bsheet%2Bclips&psc=1&smid=A2JCS0PRDR72KT&th=1
I am not impressed with Egyptian Cotton.  These sheets seem to have loose fibers that you can see and feel
column2: and they are not the "soft" I expect from cotton.  My sheets already have holes/tears at one corner.  I would not buy this item again!

column1: I bought these for my sister
column2: she loves them.  She says they are very soft and fit her bed well.  She washed then first and dried them as she would normally
column3: says they are still together and still fit her bed.

column1: The sheets have gone through two washings
column2: on cold setting
column3: and the fitted sheet has already began to shrink.  Which like its predecessor
column5: will sooner or later be very to  make the bed with.

column1: Needs to be laundryed several times because it has fuss balls. After the laundry 3 or 4 times the sheets were great!!

Don't believe them that this will fit a 21" pocket.  Someone needs to explain just because I can stretch it over the mattress isn't the only function of a sheet.  It needs to stay in place while I sleep.  Continued to shrink with each washing now my queen fitted sheet is  on my guest bed.  I figure friends and family can fight with it.
After buying numerous sheets for my huge mattress
column2: this set finally meets my needs.  I have a 21 inch latex mattress with pillowtop and these sheets fit perfectly.The comfort of these sheets is on par with what I've slept on at 5 star hotels.  The elastic works great too
column3: because the sheets don't slide off the bed.Update 1 year later:I originally forgot to mention that the sheets took a few washes before feeling very comfortable/soft
column4: but think that is worth mentioning now.The sheets are still comfortable and have held up well through numerous washes.  There are some small strings loose around the stitching
column5: but nothing that is going to unravel.The only possible con worth mentioning is the high thread count has a minor trade-off... the sheets are not very breathable.  I'm a very hot sleeper
column6: and could not rest well with a partner if temps were above 74F or so.Ultimately
column7: I'm still happy with these and will purchase again when needed.  The girlfriends liked 'em too.  :-)  Cheers.

column1: Finally sheets that stay on thick mattresses!  So soft too
I LOVE MY SHEETS! The fabric is great
column2: I don't have to struggle getting the corners over my mattress and I intend to buy another set. I recommend this sheet set to anyone who likes the feel of clean

column1: These sheets are so soft and fit my mattress great

column1: Great Strong Sheets.  Nice and crisp; wash extremely well in cold water and dry on low heat.  Very Happy with my purchase.
Fast service.Excellent quality. Gave as gift

column1: It's a nice.set of sheets

I was slightly wary that these would be cheap sheets since the other reviews don't rave about them. I loved them right out of the package. I have been sleeping on silk sheets for a few months and moving over to these was not as bad as I expected. They are pretty soft and after washing them they were even better(and my washer & dryer are ancient!).
Really nice and soft!
Love these sheets!  So glad I could fine sheets that fit my very oversized mattress.

I purchased this set specifically for the fitted sheet. I have a previously purchased set from another company (white with trim embellishments) for which I ruined the fitted sheet. My older set is 800 TC. The older set has been washed dozens of times. The older set is still better quality and with a denser
column2: thicker
column3: thread count. There is no way this product is 1000 TC unless the threads used were seriously defective. I thought perhaps the other complaints were unfounded. They are not. Perhaps the company has several offerings they are using to fill this order. The product sheet inside the package was hand-marked as to the quality (boxes checked off) so perhaps they were simply mislabeled as opposed to outright fraud. In any event

column1: Very good quality and reasonably price. Definitely more expensive if you buy it at department stores. Fast service and reliable.
Just a thought. Top sheet should have been made larger.
I was very disappointed in these sheets. They are rough and after one wash
